Detailed Description

Native format for a trainer's Pokémon party in Generation II.

Field Documentation

◆ count

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pokemon_party::count

The actual number of Pokémon in the party (0-6).

◆ species

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pokemon_party::species[PKSAV_GEN2_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON+1]

The species indices of the Pokémon in the party.

When the party is viewed in-game, it is this value that determines what Pokémon is shown, not the struct pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon.species value.

If this field is set to 0xFD, the Pokémon will be in an egg. Its field in struct pksav_gen2_pc_pokemon will correspond to its species when hatched.

The first index after the last Pokémon in the box should always be set to 0xFF.

◆ party

struct pksav_gen2_party_pokemon pksav_gen2_pokemon_party::party[PKSAV_GEN2_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON]

The actual Pokémon in the party.

◆ otnames

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pokemon_party::otnames[PKSAV_GEN2_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON][PKSAV_GEN2_POKEMON_OTNAME_STORAGE_LENGTH+1]

The names of each Pokémon's original trainer.

To access this value, you should use the function ::pksav_text_from_gen2 with a num_chars value of 10.

◆ nicknames

uint8_t pksav_gen2_pokemon_party::nicknames[PKSAV_GEN2_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON][PKSAV_GEN2_POKEMON_NICKNAME_LENGTH+1]

The nicknames of each Pokémon in the party.

To access this value, you should use the function ::pksav_text_from_gen2 with a num_chars value of 10.
